formality.high: Very formal language (e.g., 'I am writing to inform you that...')
formality.low: Casual or informal (e.g., 'Just a heads-up that...')

conciseness.high: Brief and to the point (e.g., 'Call me.')
conciseness.medium: Balanced (e.g., 'Give me a call when you can.')
conciseness.low: Verbose or wordy (e.g., 'When you have a moment, please give me a call.')

technicalLanguage.high: Specialized terminology (e.g., 'The CPU utilization is at 90%.')
technicalLanguage.medium: Some technical terms (e.g., 'The computer is running quite hard.')
technicalLanguage.low: Everyday language (e.g., 'The computer is working a lot.')

emotionalExpression.high: Strong emotional language (e.g., 'I'm absolutely thrilled about the news!')
emotionalExpression.medium: Moderate emotion (e.g., 'I am happy about the news.')

sentenceComplexity.high: Complex sentence structures (e.g., 'Despite the fact that it was raining, we decided to go for a walk.')
sentenceComplexity.medium: Moderately complex (e.g., 'It was raining, but we went for a walk.')
sentenceComplexity.low: Simple sentences (e.g., 'We walked in the rain.')

vocabularyRange.high: Advanced or rare words (e.g., 'The obfuscation of the details was intentional.')
vocabularyRange.medium: Mix of common and uncommon words (e.g., 'They hid the details on purpose.')
vocabularyRange.low: Common, everyday words (e.g., 'They hid the facts.')

idiomUsage.high: Frequent use of idioms (e.g., 'It's raining cats and dogs.')
idiomUsage.low: Literal language (e.g., 'There is a lot of rain.')

directness.medium: Moderately direct (e.g., 'Could you close the door?')
directness.low: Indirect or subtle (e.g., 'It would be great if the door was closed.')

verbalPacing.high: Quick, urgent pace (e.g., 'We need to go, now!')
verbalPacing.medium: Moderate pace (e.g., 'We should be leaving soon.')
verbalPacing.low: Slow, deliberate pace (e.g., 'I think it might be time to start thinking about leaving.')

fillerWords.high: Many filler words (e.g., 'So, like, I mean, you know, we should probably, um, get going.')
fillerWords.medium: Some filler words (e.g., 'I think we should probably get going.')

politeness.high: Very polite, formal (e.g., 'Would you be so kind as to close the window?')
politeness.medium: Moderately polite (e.g., 'Could you close the window, please?')

verbVoice.high: Active voice (e.g., 'The committee approved the proposal.')
verbVoice.medium: Mix of active and passive (e.g., 'The proposal was approved by the committee.')

detailSpecificity.high: Very specific details (e.g., 'I will meet you at the Starbucks on Main Street at 3 PM.')
detailSpecificity.medium: Some details (e.g., 'I will meet you at a coffee shop downtown in the afternoon.')
detailSpecificity.low: Vague or general (e.g., 'I will meet you somewhere later.')

tonality.high: Formal or serious tone (e.g., 'Good day. I hope you are well.')
tonality.low: Casual or friendly tone (e.g., 'Hey there! How's it going?')

figurativeLanguage.high: Heavy use of metaphors or similes (e.g., 'Her smile was as bright as the sun.')
figurativeLanguage.medium: Some figurative language (e.g., 'She had a very bright smile.')

contentRelevance.high: Highly relevant, specific content (e.g., 'Considering the recent market trends, investing in tech stocks seems prudent.')
contentRelevance.medium: Moderately relevant (e.g., 'Investing in tech stocks could be a good idea.')
contentRelevance.low: General, possibly irrelevant (e.g., 'Stocks can be a good investment.')

informationDensity.high: High density of information (e.g., 'The project involves developing a comprehensive marketing strategy, including social media campaigns, SEO optimization, and email marketing.')
informationDensity.medium: Moderate information density (e.g., 'The project involves creating a marketing strategy.')
informationDensity.low: Low information density (e.g., 'The project involves marketing.')
